Reviews.Title: “Good Price/Value”
Reviews.Author: urshinterwald
Reviews.Content: We stayed the second time in the hotel. It's situated in a great part of the city and you can not ask for more for this price especially if your up all day and walk around. The room and the bathroom are small. If you are overweight it might not be the best hotel to stay - even you would loose some calories walking up to the rooms:-) there is no elevator and if your on 6th floor it's quite a challenge after a nice Bordeau. Take the rooms with a view - since the street is very calm. The beds are in good shape and it is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for partiers”
Reviews.Author: MichelleBoro
Reviews.Content: The room was small by American standards but not by European standards. It was perfectly adequate and clean. Nice moldings and lighting. Classic tall windows that open to let in cool air in spring/summer. (Unfortunately, there is no AC.). The hotel is on a cute little tree filled square with several restaurants. On weekends, the restaurants are open until at least 1am and staff party after the last customers leave so there is noise until 3am on weekends. If you are young and want to party then this should be no problem as you will not be ready for bed until 3am. Staff spoke good english at all hours and was very helpful. We needed to change our reservation and the hotel was very accommodating. I would not stay there again because I like to go to bed by midnight but would strongly recommend this hotel for 20 something's.

Reviews.Title: “Please avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: anitasempels
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the Marrais neighbourhood, a not to miss part of Paris. We decided to go to Paris on a very short notice so the choice of hotels was very limited. We reserved at the Pratic hotel: what a disaster! We had a room as big as a box of matches: you couldn’t walk around the bed (pushed in a corner against the wall), a shower and a separate toilet but without a door (!), 5 stories high and no elevator ( the person at the reception desk didn't offerhelp with the luggage). There were painters repainting the walls around the staircase so everything was covered in plastic (very slippery stairs), we could hear everything what was happening in the rooms next doors. Luckily we were away all day and enjoying the cultural scene of Paris. Staying one night in this hotel was the maximum we could take!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, if you can”
Reviews.Author: Cybergran535
Reviews.Content: If you want to be able to sit on the loo and wash your feet at the same time, this is the hotel for you. The term 'en suite' would be to dignify the 'facility'. The shower was in the toilet! Entry was gained from a tiny double room by a swivel glass door of frosted glass. It was so tiny you could literally sit on the loo and wash your feet. Consequently it was impossible to have the towels (one each/no hand towels) or any other toiletries in the room. It was impossible to unpack as there was just nowhere to put clothes and nowhere to put suitcases. The bedsheets had holes and at 9am there was neither hot water for a shower (38C outside) nor a working television. One person had to climb over the other in the night to reach the toilet. The manager was unhelpful to the point of rudeness, initially denying the lack of hot water and TV. I cannot think of anything positive at all to say. Advice : go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “They double booked my room and refused me.”
Reviews.Author: djsherman
Reviews.Content: Do not book this hotel through an online service, such as Expedia, as they keep all records using pen and paper. I booked a room using Expedia a month in advance of my trip. Upon arrival, they claimed that my credit card was declined, even though the instructions online said I would be charged upon arrival. What really happened was that they double booked the hotel and lied to me, kicking me out on the street. About an hour later I got an email saying that they had canceled my reservation on Expedia. They retroactively canceled my reservation after check-in, which turns out to be illegal I later found out.

Reviews.Title: “A good lesson to be learnt.”
Reviews.Author: deadeggs
Reviews.Content: Having now read other reviews, it appears this hotel has a policy of paying up when you arrive and before you see the room. As soon as I checked in I was presented with the bill and asked to pay. No problem, I'm happy to conform with their policy. I was given the key to my room (N°27) and went to find the elevator. Couldn't find it so asked the man at reception who informed me that they didn't have an elevator. I suggested that as it was room N°27 that it would be on the second floor. No, he said, it's the 6th floor. OH! Soon I'm going to be 70 years old but off I went with my luggage to get up to the 6th floor. Luckly I'm fit for my age. It took awhile to make it but I got there. I passed, on the stairway near the 4th floor, a youngish woman who had checked in before me who was trying to make it with her luggage to the 5th floor. I offered to help her but she thought she'd eventually be able to make it alone. I gave her the number of the emergency ambulance service in Paris in case she needed it. I have noted that another reviewer medtioned that this is an overpriced hostel. Now I know what they mean. I realised when coming back down the staircase that it is steep, dangerous staircase. You need to keep one hand on the handrail as if you trip, you'd have a long, nasty fall. And you need to bring your suitcases down one at a time, with one hand on the handrail and the other with your suitcase (of course you have to walk back up 6 floors to get the other/s). The room; an attic room, small and not well sound proofed. Cheap hostel type furniture. Water had come in through the roof and the ceiling in the bathroom had bad paint damage. Worst of all was the toilet. If the management of this hotel would like to walk up the 6 flights of stairs and take a look at the toilet seat in room N°27, thay will find it is chipped, cracked in two and unsuitable for use from a hygiene point of view. In future, when I'm asked to pay up front on arrival for a room I'm going to insist that I see the room first. BUT, if you say no, they'd probably debit your credit card as a 'no show' as they have all your details. You have very little room to negociate once they have your credit card details and I now understand why this hotel wants you to pay up front. Nowhere in any publicity have I found any mention that there is no elevator in this hotel. At €98,00 with no breakfast for a single room on the 6th floor with no elevator, these people must be laughing all the way to the bank. It's the last time they laugh with my money.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE! DON'T EVER STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: 189852Caroline
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of different hotels in Paris as well as the rest of the world and I don't mind staying in shabby palces, that is if it's advertised and priced after it's standard. This time I went with my mom and wanted to stay at a good hotel in a nice area so I choose Hotel Pratic, worst misstake ever. They charged us 254 Euros, without breakfast for 2 nights on the 4th floor, where builiders were working from early in the morning to quite late at night, tearing down the place, loose electrical wires etc. Our room had not been cleaned, concrete, mixed with god knows what all over the place, a tiny as bed that barly fits two. The spreadsheet was nasty as hell, and one of us had to use it as a bed sheet during the first night, a fierce rash was the result! I would not go back here again if I was paid for it!

Reviews.Title: “This is not a hotel, it is an overpriced hostel”
Reviews.Author: yayangie
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel online from the U.S. and were horribly disappointed when we arrived. This is an overpriced Hostel, NOT A HOTEL. There was no phone in our room and no lock on the door. Being 2 girls traveling alone, this was an issue. We were put in a makeshift attic room. When we asked to be put in a different room the front desk worker said he had other rooms available but he would not change our room for us. I don't know why, he was just very rude to us from the beginning. We thought maybe he had a dislike for women because he seemed to talk to men customers with much more respect and courtesy, but I'm not sure. We gave him no reason to be rude. No one offered to help us carry our luggage up the 8 flights of spiral stairs into the attic room, where we had to maneuver around piles of towels and sheets allover the stairs. We did not feel safe or welcome in this hotel at all. When I said that the hotel was not as advertised and I want a refund so that we could find a better hotel they refused. These people should advertise the hotel as it is and lower the prices. The beds were horribly uncomfortable the shower had no water pressure and the sheets and blankets were super old and piling. The TV in the room is the size of a laptop screen. On a positive note, the hotel is located in a great area full of good food and nice shops. I would recommend staying somewhere else though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and narrow”
Reviews.Author: Museumsfreak
Reviews.Content: We were grandparents with granddaughter 9 years for 3 nights in Paris. The hotel is located in a friendly and quiet neigbourghood, though it is not more than 100 m to busy street of st Antoine and 300 m to Place de Bastille. Friendly and helpful staff. Beds ok but the room was very small with one pin-chair and a tiny closet. Room suitable for one person, but good humor and wonderful city saved our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Basic necessities, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: evslisw21
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location b/c so close to Ile de Cite and Ile St. Louis, yet in the Marais district. Rooms are tiny, but since we only use our room to sleep and rest, not a problem. Staff was helpful and attentive, simple breakfast was just what we needed to begin our day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingEballs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Pratic for one night on 10 June 2010 - Double room (with WC) with view. We previously stayed here in 2005, and were surprised to see read a few poor reviews on this site, but decided (from our experience last time) we would stay again - we were not disappointed. The hotel is small, but comfortable. The staff are friendly, and accommodating. Our room was ready when we arrived (11am), and they held our bags all day next day without hesitation. Rooms are very small, but clean and comfortable - besides, you don't come to the Marais to sit in your room! Place de la Bastille is only a 5min walk away, and there are numerous shops, restaurants, cafes even closer. The Metro (St-Paul) is about 3mins walk away, and is on the main line - no changes to get to many of the best sites. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced clean hotel, in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Got a great discount so was a good place to stay :)”
Reviews.Author: gsandeepdas271187
Reviews.Content: Actually I booked through a website and I booked a two duplex room but instead there was a mis communication between the website and the hotel so I made a good deal out of it. At the end i got two individual rooms for a better price. But it was kinda hectic at first since they found it little difficult to understand english. The person who speaks english was on leave that day it seems. Anyways after great research online I thought this has a good location for the price and decent rooms. The staff cleaned the room everyday. The rooms were very tidy. It is a good place to stay even with family. I am not sure whether it had restaurant because we ate only outside or bought something from takeaway restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating staff in a character loaded and quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: karen111163
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pratic Hotel unexpectedly, because of the volcano disruption with European airways. We booked directly through their website and had a last minute rate of 59 Euro which was fantastic. The young man was welcoming when we arrived, readily attempting to speak English to us in spite of our efforts to speak French. Our room was unique, in our experience: two narrow rectangles, the first being the room's entry corridor, that was flanked on one side by a small bathroom, and a separate shower stall. Both were very modern, had sliding glass doors, and were newly tiled and outfitted. The chandelier that divided the first rectangle from the second rested partly on the shower and was unavoidably knocked when I opened the tiny armoir unit. But is was fun and delightfully odd to even think of keeping the chandelier in there! The second rectangle accommodated the double bed and that's about it. The TV, which we did not use, was suspended from a ceiling bracket. The ceilings were high so we didn't feel closed in. We had one window into the centre courtyard/ shaft. No view. The room was very clean. The sheets were immaculate. The bed was comfortable. The whole place was loaded with character and quirks. The staff was very helpful the following day, keeping our luggage until late afternoon. I would stay here again, for a short stay, but I would not centre my Paris holiday around it, because the room was too small - no where to unpack, really. But that's just me, being used to more space. The area is fantastic, safe, and vibrant. No noise at night. I recommend this as an affordable, clean and friendly hotel where guests should not expect 5 star comforts - stairs and tiny spaces abound - but good conscientious inn-keeping is evident. Merci, Pratic!

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious but good value for money”
Reviews.Author: alexandrae
Reviews.Content: I went on a weekend trip to Paris to do some serious shopping (and visit the Louvre). Having previously lived in Paris, I knew I wanted to stay in the Marais for this visit. The friend I was traveling with had stayed at Hotel Pratic before, and was quite positive about it. I had read the reviews here at tripadvisor.com and was quite apprehensive, but it turned out ok. We got a room with 2 separate beds for 69 euros a night. That's CHEAP! Especially for Parisian standards. Our room was on the 5th floor, with a view of the picturesque Marché Ste Catherine. Granted, there was no elevator so we had to climb quite a lot of stairs, but other than that we were happy with our accommodation. The decoration of the room was crazy (as if a mad aunt had decorated it with Laura Ashley's craziest wall paper), but the bed was good, the bathroom was clean, the shower was nice and hot, and both towels and sheets were clean and without holes. I found the staff to be quite friendly. Yes we had to pay in advance but other than that, they were willing to help us out, be it with weather forecasts or storing our belongings when we went out for a couple of hours after checking out. If you are looking for a luxurious hotel with a lot of amenities, don't go to Pratic. If you are unable to walk or walk well, don't go here either. If you don't really care about the decoration of a room and are just looking for an affordable place to lay down your head in the centre of Paris, then yes, Pratic is for you. By the way there were builders active whilst we were staying at Pratic. One morning, one of them was making quite a bit of noise outside our room. I asked him to bugger off (nicely), and he did. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as we prefer to go to a nice Parisian bakery, such as Paul or Manon. Also, we speak French fluently, I don't know how non-French speakers are treated at this place. I assume well.

Reviews.Title: “Practic Hotel - not a good option for the Marais”
Reviews.Author: mlhnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Practic Hotel in April 2009 at the suggestion of a friend. I would not stay there again. The sheets had holes and the linens weren't changed daily - OK at a cheap hotel, but not for $150 or so a night. The carpeting was dirty, and there was no wi-fi. There must be a better option if you want to stay in the Marais. One last thing: the staff kept after me to pay everything in advance: paying for the 4 nights before we even checked in, paying in advance for breakfast, etc. If I hadn't been on a 14 hour flight prior to arriving at the hotel, I would have insisted on seeing a room before paying and looked for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rather unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: Big_Daddy_JM
Reviews.Content: Payment was required upon arrival even though I had guaranteed the room with a credit card through the hotel website. We stayed in Room 27, on the top floor. The heating did not work. It was not fun to carry luggage up and down the narrow staircase (no elevator). The room was small and cramped. The room was decorated as I imagine a pimp would decorate his home. There are presently (end of November 2008) carpenters working in the hotel, but no advance notice was provided to travelers. Place du Marche Ste Catherine is a charming spot, but I'd advise staying in one of the several hotels in close proximity to the square.

Reviews.Title: “Aggressive little tyrant”
Reviews.Author: AmazedNottinghamUK
Reviews.Content: BEWARE!!!!!!!!!! Do NOT even consider this hotel. The rooms are tiny & when we stayed, there was a major refit going on. There was no mention of this when we arrived & they put us right at the top in a box with 2 single beds. Hardly the romantic getaway. There was no discount or apology. The noise of drilling & hammering meant we could not relax properly but we came to terms with this. What followed on check out day left me stunned!!! We had assumed checkout was at 12:00 as in every other hotel I've stayed at. At around 11:35 we were just finishing our packing and there was a knock at the door. An aggressive little man pushed in when we opened the door and started shouting in French. I can speak a fair amount but he was too fast. It turned out he had been calling us on the phone but he failed to realise that there was no phone in the room. He switched to English at one point so I challenged him on the state of the room & the noise at which point he shouted that it wasn't his problem. SUCH ARROGANCE!!! He left my girlfriend in tears!!! When I challenged his behaviour as we left, he basically hurled abuse in french calling us dogs and saying [--] YOU!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for us”
Reviews.Author: DHStraveler
Reviews.Content: Our previous hotel could not extend our stay but helped us find the Pratic. There was 3 of us and I felt that the 106 euros per night was a good rate. Upon check in and the manager saw my elderly mom, he gave us a room 2 floors up instead of 3 which I truly appreciated. Mom is in fair shape and had no problem with the stairs. If we'd been higher up, we would have just climbed slower. Great exercise! Our room was small, not much room for the bags but it was clean, newer feeling, great beds and the bathroom good sized. Our view was of the small square to the right of the hotel. This property worked well for us; good location, no street noise, and safe feeling neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Never Consider Staying Here!”
Reviews.Author: MCTozzo
Reviews.Content: I read the bad reviews but decided to take a chance on The Pratic! DO NOT make the same mistake!!!! When I arrived in Paris and took the train to the hotel, I was told my room was not ready. I asked when I should check back and was told the room would not be available until the next day. They booked me at a hotel around the corner for the night. When I got there, I found out my "replacement room" had no toilet or shower. I asked to cancel my reservation and had to walk the streets of Paris looking for another hotel to stay in. DO NOT STAY AT THE PRATIC HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Third World conditions”
Reviews.Author: martini14Paris
Reviews.Content: We spent some days in that hotel, expecting a small hotel without services and any luxury accesories but nice and clean. But it turned out to be the worst hotel experience I had in my life. The rooms are so small that even for one person its a claustrofobic situation. If you share a room with someone you should know that any privacy is given. There are no seperation to the bathroom, only a curtain. And moving two persons at the same time in the room is impossible, so one person has to wait outside until the other one is ready. It is a hotel you would except to find in third world countries, but not in Paris. The location is nice.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but not great”
Reviews.Author: dck2
Reviews.Content: The area is really pretty, also the little "place" in front of the hotel. Staff was average-friendly, that was ok. The hotel has "oldfashioned charm", which you might like or not. The 27 rooms are distributed over 6 (or 7?) tiny floors, you have to climb really a lot of narrow stairs. The main problem was though that our room had a horrible odour coming out of the shower. It was a tiny, L-Shaped room; the bathroom had about the size of a wardrobe, and it was only devided from the room by a curtain (which added to the smelling-problem, because you couldn't close a door). It was a new bathroom though with new tiles - and clean. The window was soundproof and it was very quiet (but we also looked upon a tiny, tiny courtyard - or big, big airshaft, depending how you want to define it. Our friends had a nicer room. I guess you should ask for the rooms looking to the street/"place": I got I glimpse on one and it was normally shaped (retangular) and looked good.

HotelInfo.Name: Pratic Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 9 Rue Dormesson, 75004 Paris, France
